MUST add constraints: unique(workspace_id,event_key), unique(delivery_id,event_type) in webhook_delivery, and unique(event_id,object_type,object_id,qualifier) in event_object_relation. MUST add indexes: (workspace_id,occurred_at), (actor_id,occurred_at), (repo_id,occurred_at), (event_type,occurred_at), and (object_type,object_id) for relation lookups. SHOULD partition activity_event by time if volume warrants. MUST add tests for insert/query + idempotent upsert. Failure modes: missing timestamps, ambiguous linkage, slow queries, duplicate events, FK failures on deleted objects. Tests: persistence + index usage smoke.

title: Event semantics taxonomy + envelope
description: Define mentor-ready event semantics: verbs, object types, and relation qualifiers.
acceptance_criteria:
MUST define event_type taxonomy + versioning for v1; MUST define object_type taxonomy (pull_request, issue, review, review_comment, issue_comment, repository, workspace, user, team) and relation qualifiers (actor, target, container, mentions); SHOULD align verbs with ActivityStreams 2.0 (Create/Update/Review/Comment/Merge); MUST include explicit v1 mapping table for handled webhooks (below); MUST map each event_type to leaderboard metrics; MUST explicitly list which existing webhook handlers are excluded from the ledger (e.g., installation/team/membership/label/milestone/review_thread) to avoid silent gaps; MUST add validation tests for taxonomy consistency. Failure modes: inconsistent names, ambiguous object mapping, claiming support for events without handlers. Tests: taxonomy validation tests.

V1 mapping table (derive from existing handlers only):
- pull_request.opened (GH pull_request action=opened): objects {pull_request:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=pull_request.created_at.
- pull_request.ready_for_review (action=ready_for_review): objects {pull_request:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=pull_request.updated_at.
- pull_request.reopened (action=reopened): objects {pull_request:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=pull_request.updated_at.
- pull_request.closed (action=closed, merged=false): objects {pull_request:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=pull_request.closed_at.
- pull_request.merged (action=closed, merged=true): objects {pull_request:target, repository:container, user:actor, user:merged_by(optional)}; occurred_at=pull_request.merged_at.
- review.submitted (pull_request_review action=submitted): objects {review:target, pull_request:container, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=review.submitted_at.
- review.dismissed (action=dismissed): objects {review:target, pull_request:container, repository:container, user:actor(optional)}; occurred_at=review.submitted_at or dismissed_at if available.
- review_comment.created (pull_request_review_comment action=created): objects {review_comment:target, pull_request:container, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=comment.created_at.
- review_comment.edited (action=edited): same objects; occurred_at=comment.updated_at.
- review_comment.deleted (action=deleted): same objects; occurred_at=now or comment.updated_at.
- issue.opened (issues action=opened): objects {issue:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=issue.created_at.
- issue.closed (action=closed): objects {issue:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=issue.closed_at.
- issue.reopened (action=reopened): objects {issue:target, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=issue.updated_at.
- issue_comment.created (issue_comment action=created): objects {issue_comment:target, issue:container, repository:container, user:actor}; occurred_at=comment.created_at.
- issue_comment.edited/deleted: same objects; occurred_at=comment.updated_at or now if missing.
Edge case: if issue_comment payload indicates pull_request (issue.hasPullRequest), treat container as pull_request instead of issue for mentor/leaderboard semantics.
close_reason: Event taxonomy implemented: PR, review, issue, bad practice, notification, engagement, deployment events

title: Ingestion pipeline for leaderboard events
description: Emit activity ledger entries for current leaderboard signals (PRs, reviews, issues, comments) from NATS webhooks.
acceptance_criteria:
MUST emit events for PR opened/merged, review submitted, review comment, issue opened/closed, issue comment (and any other leaderboard inputs); MUST attach workspace_id + repo_id + actor_id; MUST ensure idempotency using delivery GUID from NATS headers when present; MUST fall back to deterministic event_key for sync/webhook reconciliation (see rules below); MUST compute payload hash + size; MUST store observed_at vs occurred_at; MUST validate webhook signatures before ingest (via webhook-ingest) and record signature_valid metadata; MUST add tests per event type + idempotency + metadata. Failure modes: duplicate events, missing workspace linkage, non-deterministic keys. Tests: ingestion unit tests + idempotency + metadata validation.

Event_key rules (fallback when delivery GUID missing):
- pull_request.opened: prId + created_at.
- pull_request.ready_for_review / reopened: prId + action + updated_at.
- pull_request.closed (not merged): prId + closed_at.
- pull_request.merged: prId + merged_at.
- review.submitted: reviewId + submitted_at.
- review.dismissed: reviewId + "dismissed" + (dismissed_at or submitted_at).
- review_comment.created: commentId + created_at.
- review_comment.edited/deleted: commentId + action + updated_at.
- issue.opened: issueId + created_at.
- issue.closed: issueId + closed_at.
- issue.reopened: issueId + "reopened" + updated_at.
- issue_comment.created: commentId + created_at.
- issue_comment.edited/deleted: commentId + action + updated_at.

Edge cases to cover: issue_comment on pull request (treat container as pull_request for leaderboard semantics); review_comment deleted events should still be logged for timeline even if comment entity is deleted; ensure that REST sync does not emit duplicate open/closed events when timestamps unchanged.
